message:
SYSTEM: PROLEGintro_eng_long.pdf: Página 44
PROLEG semantics a la ASP(continued)
Let M be a set of atoms. We deﬁne a set of applicable rules w.r.t.
M, HM, as follows:
{R ∈H|¬∃exception(head(R), E) ∈E s.t. E ∈M}.
This means that if some exception is found for a conclusion H of rule
R, we do not consider such rule R for derivation.
The semantics of P (called an extension of P) is given as a set of
atoms M s.t. M = min(HM)
where min(T) is the minimum model of a set of Horn clauses T.
44
speaker: SYSTEM
